description: An investigative program has revealed that the Sweden Democrats party has been spreading disinformation via anonymous accounts. Party boss Jimmie Akesson has counter-attacked by denouncing an influencing campaign against his movement.
title: In Sweden, the far right makes the political debate Trump-esque

description: The Spanish team has now won their last nine European Cup finals and won the competition six times in the last 11 seasons. However, not for the first time in that run, they had to rely on some good fortune as underdogs Dortmund were left to bitterly regret not making the most of their first-half chances.
title: Champions League: Record-breaking Madrid wins title for the fifteenth time

description: Without Ben Gvir's and Smotrich's parties, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's coalition could lose its majority in parliament.
title: Israel-Hamas war: Israeli far-right ministers threaten to quit if Biden ceasefire plan goes ahead

description: With 'Comics on Every Floor,' five simultaneous exhibitions featuring graphic novels, manga and comics celebrate a long-neglected art form in Paris.
title: Centre Pompidou finally turns its attention to comics

description: Attendees at Democratic Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez's monthly town hall meeting on Thursday, May 30, mainly discussed issues of local concern.
title: Politics in the Bronx borough is a world away from Manhattan and Trump's legal troubles

description: The Israeli prime minister has been reluctant to explicitly commit himself to a ceasefire. His emissaries at the negotiating table suspect him of 'sabotaging' their efforts in order to prolong the war and keep himself in power.
title: Biden's Gaza plan, deemed 'positive' by Hamas, forces Netanyahu to face his contradictions

description: The 'first cycling Games in history,' as the organizers call them, are based on the promise of 415 kilometers of bike lanes, some of which have been specially created for the event and will be retained after the Olympic Games. Some hope that the sporting event will stimulate bike use in the Paris metropolis, as it did after the pandemic.
title: Paris 2024: Cycling already a winner

description: Financial bubbles, latent capital losses, opaque markets and abysmal public deficit: The warning signs of a financial shock are proliferating in an American economy that has not been able to rid itself of its slow poisons – high inflation and high interest rates.
title: The US sees the clouds of a financial crisis gathering on the horizon

description: With the lowering of France's credit rating by S&P, the French draft budget for 2025 looks particularly difficult to put together, giving the impression that the current admnistration has done no better than its predecessors.
title: France's bad grade from Standard & Poor's shakes its economic credibility

description: On June 2, the left-wing former mayor of Mexico City is expected to win Mexico's presidential election. At 61, Sheinbaum is buoyed by her advocacy actions for women's rights, in a country where the number of femicides has reached record highs.
title: Claudia Sheinbaum, Mexico's likely feminist-in-chief

description: The day after his conviction in the Stormy Daniels hush money trial, the former US president presented himself as the sacrificial victim of a 'fascist state.' In contrast, the current American leader applauded the smooth running of institutions.
title: Conspiracy or rule of law: Trump and Biden each try to exploit the New York verdict in their own way

description: Robinson lived in the White House with the first family, helping care for her young granddaughters and providing a stabilizing presence in one of the world's most stressful residences.
title: Michelle Obama's mother Marian Robinson dies at 86

description: Since the October 7, 2023 Hamas terrorist attack in Israel, the French education ministry has recorded some 1,450 racist and anti-Semitic acts, among all ages. This phenomenon has been underway for several years, and now reaches as early as elementary school.
title: French schools see anti-Semitism and racism expressed increasingly earlier: 'There are no longer any taboos'

description: A favorite of night owls, the cultural event is back for a 23rd edition on Saturday, June 1, with free performances and installations focused this year on French overseas territories.
title: Paris's 'Nuit Blanche': Ten things to do in and around the city during the night-time arts festival

description: Despite their growing popularity, cryptocurrencies have a history of scandal and sudden price collapses. Thieves stole 850,000 bitcoins from the Japanese exchange Mt. Gox in 2014. It was worth around $470 million at the time.
title: Japan: $300 mn bitcoin lost in 'leak'

description: Even though the Israeli prime minister has recognized Rabat's sovereignty over this territory, Moroccan newspapers see it as a provocation.
title: Outcry in Morocco after Netanyahu presents map of kingdom without Western Sahara on French TV

description: The goal of phasing out coal as part of the transition to cleaner energy sources is clashing with the soaring electricity demands of the data centers required for the development of artificial intelligence, explains economic columnist Philippe Escande.
title: ChatGPT: 'The Achilles heel of artificial intelligence is its energy consumption'
